review_text: We really enjoyed our stay! This was an overnight stop on a 12 hour road trip, so unfortunately we weren’t there for long but we were very comfortable while we were. The space was well appointed, you could easily stay here for an extended period. There was plenty of hot water and good pressure in the shower (something that can make or break a stay for me) and the linens were good quality. The mattress was great, we slept really well. Parking is literally steps from the door which was extremely convenient for loading/unloading. The only potential negative is the proximity to the train tracks, in fairness the listing does mention this. We travel with a white noise machine so it was a non-issue for us when it came time for bed. But just be aware, you’re close enough that you can see the tracks from the living room window and several trains will likely come through, so if you’re a light sleeper be prepared. Regina was a thoughtful and attentive host with great communication!

review_text:
[For reference, 5 girls rented the cabin to stay for a long weekend to attend a wedding at the Peach Barn.]
THE HOSTS
Margaret and Hank were incredibly kind and accommodating hosts!
THE PROPERTY
The photos of the outside part of the property do not do the place justice! The land itself is incredibly beautiful, especially when the flowers are in bloom! The inside is a "hunters cabin" theme (read below about the decor). Please note that the location of the property in Georgia makes WiFi and cell service a bit fickle.
THE BREAKFAST
We had one of the most amazing breakfasts we've ever had! Margaret & Hank's homemade waffles, blueberry sauce, and whipped cream were incredible! We highly recommend!
THINGS TO NOTE
(1) Please note that the "leopard room" photo attached to the listing is a separate space that is inside the main house and not part of the cabin. When renting the cabin, you get a large open layout where one of the beds is on the main floor and then the other 3 beds are in the loft space.
(2) Additionally, I also wanted to note that there is quite a bit of taxidermy displayed in the space for those that may not have encountered that before or do have a phobia. There are multiple deer, antlers, fish, birds, and some type of bob cat displayed. The theme of the place is a "hunters cabin" so just make sure you are personally okay with that before you book the place
Overall, our stay at the cabin was very nice and it was great for the five friends to reunite after 4 years and attend a wedding. We appreciate Margaret and Hank's hospitality!

review_text: What a find. A perfect getaway for an individual, couple OR family. We stayed in the Pond House and it was incredible. It really felt like we were on vacation, at a private, luxurious hunting cabin. Margaret was a gracious and accommodating host, and even brought breakfast to our cabin instead of us eating it in the house since I am allergic to the cats that live in the main house. This place would be PERFECT for a city-dwelling family that has youngsters. They can fish, play on the playground, run around, and just hang out! The loft has a double bed and two twin beds, and the main room has a double bed. Technically it could sleep 6 in beds, but there is also a couch and love seat! Wifi worked fine, cable TV was fine, bedding was comfortable, and we really felt like we had a retreat. When we left to head to Atlanta, we drove north on Highway 41, roughly parallel to I-75 and had a cultural experience as we identified all different types of agriculture - melons, pecan groves, cotton and peanut fields, and some fabulous small and charming small towns. We will go back and recommend it to others.
